source.title: A cruise among Haida and Tlingit villages about Dixon's Entrance
source.author: George A. Dorsey

divs.text: Her finger provided the drama, ploughing a traumatic furrow across the well-worn path.
The ants scurried in confusion, and Samar Dev watched them scrabbling fierce with the insult.
The soldiers with their heads lifted and mandibles opened wide as if they would challenge the gods.
Or, in this case, a woman slowly dying of thirst.
The deliverance of discord into otherwise predictable, truncated and sordid lives seemed a worthwhile thing.
Well, perhaps not worthwhile, but certainly interesting.

God-like thoughts, then, to mark her last day among the living.

- Steven Erikson, The Bonehunters, Malazan Book of the Fallen
